results.title: Antidiabetic Drugs Can Reduce the Harmful Impact of Chronic Smoking on Post-Traumatic Brain Injuries
results.text_hl: Antidiabetic drugs such as @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ (@<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@MF@@@) and @CHEMICAL_Rosiglitazone @CHEMICAL_MESH:D000077154 @@@rosiglitazone@@@ (@CHEMICAL_Rosiglitazone @CHEMICAL_MESH:D000077154 @@@RSG@@@) were shown to prevent/reduce @<m>DISEASE_Glut1_Deficiency_Syndrome</m> @DISEASE_MESH:C536830 @@@BBB damage@@@ promoted by chronic @SPECIES_671417 @@@TS@@@ exposure.

citations.NLM: Sivandzade F, Alqahtani F, Dhaibar H, Cruz-Topete D, Cucullo L. Antidiabetic Drugs Can Reduce the Harmful Impact of Chronic Smoking on Post-Traumatic Brain Injuries Int J Mol Sci. 2023 Mar 25;24(7):. PMID: 37047198
citations.BibTeX: @article{37047198, title={Antidiabetic Drugs Can Reduce the Harmful Impact of Chronic Smoking on Post-Traumatic Brain Injuries}, author={Sivandzade F and Alqahtani F and Dhaibar H and Cruz-Topete D and Cucullo L}, journal={Int J Mol Sci}, volume={24}, number={7}}

results.title: P53 mediates the protective effects of metformin in inflamed lung endothelial cells.
results.text_hl: In the current study, we assess the protective effects of @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@MET@@@ in @CHEMICAL_Lipopolysaccharides @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008070 @@@LPS@@@-induced lung @<m>DISEASE_Glut1_Deficiency_Syndrome</m> @DISEASE_MESH:C536830 @@@endothelial barrier dysfunction@@@ and evaluate the role of @GENE_TP53 @GENE_7157 @@@P53@@@ in mediating the beneficial effects of @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@MET@@@ in the vasculature.

citations.NLM: Kubra KT, Uddin MA, Akhter MS, Leo AJ, Siejka A, Barabutis N. P53 mediates the protective effects of metformin in inflamed lung endothelial cells. Int Immunopharmacol. 2021 Dec;101(Pt B):108367. PMID: 34794886
citations.BibTeX: @article{34794886, title={P53 mediates the protective effects of metformin in inflamed lung endothelial cells.}, author={Kubra KT and Uddin MA and Akhter MS and Leo AJ and Siejka A and Barabutis N}, journal={Int Immunopharmacol}, volume={101}, number={Pt B}, pages={108367}}

results.title: Metformin Protects against LPS-Induced Intestinal Barrier Dysfunction by Activating AMPK Pathway.
results.text_hl: @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@Metformin@@@ Protects against @CHEMICAL_Lipopolysaccharides @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008070 @@@LPS@@@-Induced Intestinal @<m>DISEASE_Glut1_Deficiency_Syndrome</m> @DISEASE_MESH:C536830 @@@Barrier Dysfunction@@@ by Activating @GENE_PRKAA1 @GENE_5562 @@@AMPK@@@ Pathway.

citations.NLM: Wu W, Wang S, Liu Q, Shan T, Wang Y. Metformin Protects against LPS-Induced Intestinal Barrier Dysfunction by Activating AMPK Pathway. Mol Pharm. 2018 Aug 6;15(8):3272-3284. PMID: 29969038
